data.title: James Franco makes red carpet return after 'inappropriate behaviour' allegation
data.meta_description: James Franco has ended his red carpet hiatus five years after being accused of 'inappropriate behaviour.'
data.text:
James Franco was all smiles as he made his red carpet comeback alongside his girlfriend of seven years and actress Isabel Pakzad.

In 2019, the actor was sued by five students who attended his film school, Studio 4 and was accused of behaving inappropriately.

The 46-year-old was also alleged to have acted sexually toward them, even forcing one to perform oral sex.

Although Franco’s attorney denied the allegations at the time, and eventually he settled the suit, the actor seemingly disappeared from the limelight.

However, he made his return to attend the Kind of Kindness premiere in Cannes, France this week.

Read more: Emma Stone dazzles in dramatic plunging gown at star-studded premiere

Franco wore a black suit, with a white shirt and bow tie while actress Pakzad went braless under a plunging black blazer adorned with metal chains.

The 28-year-old added split-flared trousers and heels to her look as she supported her boyfriend.

Although the filmmaker has not worked on a project since the accusations, Franco attended the premiere to promote his new film, The Razor's Edge with director Tommy Lee Jones.

It will be his first film appearance since The Deuce in 2018, aside from lending his voice in the animated Arctic Dogs which premiered the following year.

Meryl Streep and Jane Fonda lead age-defying stars stealing the show at Cannes [PHOTOS]

In 2021, Franco opened up about the allegations in a podcast interview and reiterated his belief that any sexual contact between him and his students had been consensual.

“Over the course of my teaching, I did sleep with students, and that was wrong,” he said.

“I suppose at the time, my thinking was, if it's consensual, OK.”

Franco continued: “At the time, I was not clear-headed. I was in recovery before for substance abuse. There were some issues that I had to deal with that were also related to addiction.

“And so I've really used my recovery background to kind of start examining this and changing who I was.”
